Extrusion Extrude the sketch along its normal direction by 0.1269 units. prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the created coordinate system. Create the first face (face_1) using a loop (loop_1) with the following line segments: - line_1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.5, 0.0] - line_2: [0.5, 0.0] to [0.5, 0.625] - line_3: [0.5, 0.625] to [0.25, 0.625] - line_4: [0.25, 0.625] to [0.25, 0.25] - line_5: [0.25, 0.25] to [0.0, 0.25] - line_6: [0.0, 0.25] to [0.0, 0.0] Apply a scaling factor of 0.625 to the sketch. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch, then extrude it with the following properties: - Depth towards the normal: 0.75 - Depth opposite the normal: 0.0 - Operation: Create a new solid body The resulting prism has the following dimensions: - Length: 0.625 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.625 Part 2: Rectangular prism with a smaller offset prism Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.25, 0.0, 0.625] Draw a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the created coordinate system. Create two faces (face_1 and face_2) using separate loops (loop_1 for each face) with the following line segments: Face_1: - line_1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.25, 0.0] - line_2: [0.25, 0.0] to [0.25, 0.2362] - line_3: [0.25, 0.2362] to [0.0, 0.2362] - line_4: [0.0, 0.2362] to [0.0, 0.0] Face_2: - line_1: [0.0, 0.4862] to [0.25, 0.4862] - line_2: [0.25, 0.4862] to [0.25, 0.75] - line_3: [0.25, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.75] - line_4: [0.0, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.4862] Apply a scaling factor of 0.75 to both sketches. Transform the 2D sketches into 3D sketches, then extrude them from the XY plane with the following properties: - Face_1: - Depth towards the normal: 0.125 - Operation: Add material to the existing body on the right side of the original prism - Face_2: - Depth towards the normal: 0.125 - Operation: Add material to the existing body on the left side of the new prism The final shape will be a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a triangular cutout on one side. The height, width, and length of this shape and its parts are provided in the description sections of the respective parts.</description>
